data.text: Folia faunistica Slovaca, 2010, 15 (9): 61–93 introduction A checklist of MicrolepidopterA occured in slovAkiA (lepidopterA: MicrolepidopterA) Gabriel Pastorális Košická 22/39, 945 01 Komárno, Slovakia [pastoralisg@gmail.com] pastorális G, 2010: A checklist of Microlepidoptera occured in slovakia (lepidoptera: Microlepidoptera). Folia faunistica Slovaca, 15 (9): 61–93. Abstract: The latest checklist of Microlepidoptera of Slovakia (Pastorális & Reiprich 1995) is revised and supplemened with new records and updated information. Numerous new distributional data are provided and taxonomical changes based on literary sources of the years past are taken into account. All new references regarding to changes of the Slovak fauna are added. key words: checklist, Microlepidoptera, Slovakia. This checklist is an updated and revised version of the latest checklist of Microlepidoptera of Slovakia (Pastorális & Reiprich 1995). It was published only in a modest printing and thus was little available. Necessity of the new uptaded and more accessible checklist arised during the past years. The presented checklist is supplemented with species of Microlepidoptera new to the Slovak fauna. The classification and nomenclature follow mainly The Lepidoptera of Europe, the 2nd version of the distributional checklist (Karsholt & Nieukerken 2009). Numbers of first references from Slovakia are given after each species names beginning with the basic faunistic work, Prodromus Lepidopterorum Slovaciae (Hrubý 1964). Hrubý’s reference comprises all older literary sources concerning the fauna up to 1960. If some of records from Slovakia was published firstly abroad a reference regarding to it is numbered, too. In a separate section several selected genus and species are annotated. In particular, list of species yet published from the territory of Slovakia but now excluded from various reasons is also done. In the near future the checklist shall appear in eform with regular supplementations. A checklist of fAMilies, GenerA And species Comments: Numbers of first references from Slovakia are after the names of species; references in table 1.
